newsitem.title: UK: Euro oil swaps nudge higher, supported by crude.
newsitem.headline: Euro oil swaps nudge higher, supported by crude.

text.p: European oil swaps ticked higher on Friday, emboldened by stronger crude futures reflecting some fund short-covering.
Brent crude CFDs gained 5-10 cents while gasoline tracked $2 higher and heavy fuel was $1 firmer.
Dealers said June 16-20 CFDs were valued around -53 cents under August Brent compared with -65 cents on Thursday with June 23-27 placed around -47/48 against -55 cents.
Further out the contract gained 10 cents or so with June 30-July 4 hovering around -39 cents under August from -48/49 while July 7-11 was put at -33 from -42.

Gasoline swaps were $2 a tonne stronger with July traded in the morning at $185.50. Several dealers commented on heavy buying by one company on the physical market which they said looked like a squeeze possibly linked to a long swaps position.
Heavy fuel ticked up $1 or so with June little talked and July put at $84.75 and August at $85.50. Physical barges were traded at $86 and $87.
Gas oil crack spreads were put steady on 4Q97 at $4.55 with 1Q98 unchanged around $4.58 and 2Q98 at $4.05.
